intro: Galium canum subsp. antalyense, commonly known as Antalya bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Turkey. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry berries that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks.
